page.title: 03Travel around Birchwood
page.content: Birchwood Newtown consists of three villages:Oakwood,Locking Stumps and Gorse Covert.These villages are well served by road and rail.Birchwood Centre has 1600 free parking spaces and regular bus and train services. The British Rail Station is only a three minute walk from the centre. Birchwood Newtown has more miles of Motorway around it than any other New Town in Britain.The Motorways are M6 M62 and M56.This means it is easy to travel swiftly to Manchester or London or Liverpool or Hull. It takes only about twenty minutes to drive to Manchester International Airport or to Liverpool Airport. An expressway partially provides access from Warrington town centre.
